extendedInfo.description: Sportablet allows you to connect your Garmin Forerunner or Edge directly to your Android tablet. Provides all the activity details and statistics, charts, maps, and can save to SD card, upload to Garmin Connect, Strava, Training Peaks, SportTracks, Endomondo, RunningAHEAD, export to GPX, and post to Facebook. The app can also import FIT and TCX files from sdcard, flash drives, etc.You can also track all your gear (shoes etc), calculate mileage, cost per mile/km, etc.At this time, the app requires a 10" tablet. If you have a smaller tablet or a smartphone, please see my Uploader for Garmin instead: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.carlopescio.uploaderThese devices are supported:Forerunner 201 and 301Forerunner 305 and 205Forerunner 10, 110 and 210Forerunner 405, 405CX, 410 are in beta: http://goo.gl/XJKPjForerunner 310xt, 610, 910xt are in beta: http://goo.gl/ixrmQForerunner 50, 60, 70 are in alpha: http://goo.gl/DPDKHGarmin Swim is in alpha: http://goo.gl/DPDKHEdge 205 and 305Edge 500, 705 and 800eTrex 30, eTrex Legend HCx, ForeTrex 401Oregon 550tGpsMap csx 60also reported working with Astro 200, Montana and the Garmin Fenix.For more details, see http://www.sportablet.com/answers.html. If you have troubles, take a look at http://www.sportablet.com/help.htmlNote: Edge 500/705/800 and Forerunner 110/210 may take a while to mount (up to 20 sec). Be patient, the app will start when they're recognized as USB devices by the tablet.Sportablet is free to try: you can upload all activities, but explore only the most recent one. Once you know that it works fine with your Garmin device and Android tablet, and if you like what you see, you can activate it with an in-app purchase on Google Play (price is about 5 euros / 6.6 $).Note: in-app purchases are slow, and may take a couple of minutes to be confirmed. Don't panic :-).

reviews.title: Works like a charm & great support
reviews.comment: Have been using this with my forerunner 410 and iconia A510 for the last year or so and couldn\'t live without it. Carlo responds super quick to any issues and is always updating. An absolute bargain at \302\2434. To be able to view, upload and share my run and cycle activity without a laptop is great.
reviews.author: Lucas Longman

reviews.title: Samsung tab 2 10.1 and Garmin Forerunner 205
reviews.comment: I use this app first with galaxy tab 2 and. Forerunner 410 work like a charm ... don\'t need to use my compurter anymore.  I change my watch with forerunner 205... And now strong team!      Carlo hepl me a lot with advice ... I recomand this app for everyone who don\'t want to be dependent to a computer or laptop... I can upload my tracks when i\'m on the hollyday  :)))  Worth 6 stars not 5!
reviews.author: Valentin R

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: How anyone can say this is overpriced at just over \302\2434 is beyond me!  Garmin haven\'t bothered to write anything for Android and I paid nearly \302\243400 for that. This does what it says on the tin, connects your Garmin!  I have personally saved the file and uploaded to Strava from there, seems more sensible than sending the file directly,  You can also see the Garmin file structure so you can download a TXC route from Ridewithgps etc. and copy it into the New Files folder on your Garmin. No need to muck around with a laptop anymore!
reviews.author: Dave Pettitt

reviews.title: NOT FREE !!!!!!!!!!
reviews.comment: beware this app is based on a lie, you\'ll need to pay before you can use it.
reviews.author: Rob Turner

reviews.title: Works great!
reviews.comment: Asus Transformer Infinity and Forerunner 410.  Works like a charm.  Lots of room for new features to be added, but lets me retrieve tracks, and share to Garmin Connect & Strava with a few clicks.  Thanks for a great program!
reviews.author: Stephen Byl

reviews.title: Wow.Just Wow
reviews.comment: Review update after 2m use; still great and more keeps coming. responsive developer, app works really well with my Garmin 305. Five well-earned stars,nice one
reviews.author: David Morris

reviews.title: Really meant for 10\" tablet
reviews.comment: I tried it on a N7 w/ a 405.  It was able to download runs but the app really doesn\'t render right on a small tablet.
reviews.author: Mario Limonciello

reviews.title: Great App ... Gets 5 stars when more features
reviews.comment: Just what\'s I wanted. Able to import my Garmin 305 data into my Nexus 10. Thus, when I take long multiple day bike touring trips, I can record my daily rides (about 70 miles per day). In the past my 305 would become full after about four days. The Nexus 10 also allows me to pre-cache Google Maps and use GPS location when off line. The combination is sweet!
reviews.author: Richard Hoeg

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: Works really well for data transfer and upload. The developer is very responsive and helpful as well and has been adding more Garmin device compatibility which is great .
reviews.author: Glenn Strong

reviews.title: Excellent app with very proactive developer
reviews.comment: This atop just keeps getting better and better
reviews.author: Pete Luxford

reviews.title: Excellent App
reviews.comment: Carlo has carried out an excellent job uplifting the app to be compatible with my Garmin Forerunner 410.  Another job that I no longer require a Windows PC for.  I tried this on my Asus Transformer TF300T with no issues and uploaded to GarminConnect as well.  Keep up the good work.
reviews.author: Doug Mitchell

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Worked like a charm for my Asus TF101 and Edge 305.  I don\'t really need features other than the uploader functionality to get a file on my SD card so that I could upload manually to Strava and an eventual SportTracks tablet app.  Can\'t wait for the XT310/ANT compatibility.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: saved my data
reviews.comment: and the developer has been in contact with me to assist, in spite of my initial scepticism
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent App
reviews.comment: Have been looking for a way to avoid taking a laptop on cycling trips to download my Garmin devices (800 and 305) and thought I might be able to find something for my wife\'s Playbook - to no avail.  Then I came across Sportablet and I have actually abandoned my love of RIM and bought an Android Tablet just to use this app and it does not disappoint.  Looking forward to the various updates in the roadmap, but right now, it does exactly what is needed, what more can you ask for ?   Flawless functioning when downloading my own 305 and my wife\'s 305 along with my 800 onto an Asus Transformer TF300.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: overpriced
reviews.comment: Zero functionality, very high price.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Edge500
reviews.comment: Does not mount at all, does not recognise my edge 500
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: a godsend
reviews.comment: this app is just perfect for me. I\'m surprised by some comments, maybe you don\'t understand how hard it is to write an app like this. It took Garmin years to clean up its Plugin on Windows, and they have all the specs. This guy is doing everything out of thin air, going where Garmin won\'t go (Android).  I\'m a hardware engineer by trade, I exchanged a few emails with the developer and he actually taught me something about USB, so talk to him if you find any issue. I happily paid activation to support his work!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great, unique app
reviews.comment: The only app that can download data from my forerunner 305 and 210. A joy to use. Sure, a few things are \"coming soon\". But it does more than enough, plus, can save directly into Garmin Connect and share to facebook with one touch! Happy to leave my notebook in the dust now :-)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good but has glitch with Garmin Connect.
reviews.comment: It does what I need it to. I can upload my run data from my Forerunner 305 and then transmit it to Garmin Connect. After I transmit to Garmin though, I have to delete the activity from the app and the file in File Manager. Otherwise, the next time I try to transmit to Garmin Connect, the app crashes. Aside from that, I\'m very happy with the app.
reviews.author: Bryce Bills

reviews.title: *A*W*E*S*O*M*E*
reviews.comment: A dream come true; I can upload from my garmin without a PC. Nice charts and map, hope to get gear tracking soon. Happy to use this app disconnected, and still being able to upload to garmin connect and facebook if I want to. Works with my forerunner and edge, looking forward to ANT+ support.
reviews.author: A Google User
